title: Economics of Ageing
description:
The course covers the theories and empirics of economics of ageing. There are three segments. The first segment introduces the concepts of population ageing and economic models incorporating effects of aging. The second segment equips students with methodology and tools to approach the topic on ageing. The last segment highlights the economic impacts of ageing, in terms of economic growth, fiscal pressures and sustainability, pension analyses and health financing. With reference to Singapore’s context, this course will examine policy options
available to mitigate the effects of ageing, including their trade-offs.
prerequisite: Completed 80 MCs, including 28 MCs in EC, with a minimum CAP of 3.20 or be on the Honours track. EC3101, EC3102, EC3303, and EC3305
